The image is satirical because it contrasts simplicity and complexity through visual elements and captions.

On the left, a simple chair is labeled "YES," representing something straightforward and uncomplicated. On the right, there is a person sitting and looking at a phone with their reflection in a mirror, labeled "BUT." This side highlights modern life's complexity and distraction due to technology.

The humor arises from the unexpected juxtaposition and commentary on how a simple activity like sitting becomes complicated and distracting when technology is involved. The mirror adds a layer of irony, showing how the person is both engaged with the phone and observing themselves, emphasizing distraction and self-awareness in the digital age.
